description: Getting 2016 off to a sunny start, Little Mix's Perrie Edwards, 22, is currently enjoying a winter break in the Maldives.
title: Little Mix's Perrie Edwards shows off her pert posterior in white string bikini
title_page: Little Mix's Perrie Edwards shows off her pert posterior in white string bikini | Daily Mail Online
text:
She overcame heartbreak last year when her ex fiancé Zayn Malik called off their engagement.
But getting 2016 off to a sunny start, Little Mix's Perrie Edwards is currently enjoying a winter break in the Maldives.
Taking to her Instagram account on Monday to give her followers a glimpse of her tropical paradise, the singer, 22, cut a cheeky figure as she uploaded a bikini snap.
Scroll Down For Video
Cheeky: Perrie Edwards showed off her pert posterior in a string bikini on Monday in the Maldives
Resting one hand on the trunk of a tree, the 22-year-old had her back to the camera as she flaunted her stunning curves.
With her golden tresses cascading down her back, Edwards appeared to be embracing the glorious weather as she enjoyed some time off her hectic schedule.
Donning a white string bikini, Perrie simply accompanied the snap with an emoji of a palm tree.
'Holiday crib': The 22-year-old gave fans a glimpse of her accommodation for her winter break to South Asia
'Farewell': On Saturday, Edwards hid behind a pair of reflective shades as she uploaded a selfie
The former X Factor champion also shared a shot of her picturesque accommodation for the duration of her winter getaway.
Edwards captioned the photograph, which showcased the bungalow, blue skies and sandy floor: 'Holiday crib'.
Before touching down in South Asia, Perrie shared a pre-holiday selfie as she hid behind a pair of reflective sunglasses.
Meanwhile Edwards recently thanked her Little Mix bandmates for helping her move on after being dumped by Zayn Malik last summer.
Speaking to Fabulous magazine, Perrie revealed: 'My bond with Jade, Jesy and Leigh-Anne this year has become even stronger.
'They’re the most incredibly supportive girls and I'm very grateful to have them.'
